alert.note: Alert for Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 23 at 6:30PM CDT until May 23 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Lubbock County in northwestern Texas... Northeastern Hockley County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Hale County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Lamb County in northwestern Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 629 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Anton, or 13 miles west of Abernathy, moving north at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR AREAS EAST OF ANTON AND NORTH OF SHALLOWATER. A second severe storm was located near Whitharrel moving east near 15 mph. This second storm is capable of two inch hail. HAZARD...Softball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Levelland, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Anton, Spade, Whitharral, Reese Center, Smyer and Opdyke West. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...4.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
